title: Struggling to survive in cash-starved Afghanistan
description: Eight months into Taliban rule, the economy and health services have been shattered as funding dries up.

title: KGF 2, RRR, Pushpa: The southern Indian films winning on Bollywood's turf
description: The recent theatrical success of movies like KGF 2 and RRR has revived a debate on the "pan-Indian" film.

title: Happening director Audrey Diwan says abortion should not be 'a silent topic'
description: Award-winning director Audrey Diwan talks about how her own abortion led her to make her new film.

title: Shanghai lockdown: Whole communities relocated in anti-Covid drive
description: One community faces relocation to quarantine facilities more than 100 miles (160km) away.

title: 'A great sense of humour': But what makes the Queen laugh?
description: As she turns 96, the Queen's sense of humour is hailed as an important, if often hidden, quality.

title: 'Sip and shop': The retailers tempting you in with alcohol
description: A small but growing number of High Street stores are offering customers a glass of wine.

title: Liege-Bastogne-Liege: Cycling's oldest spring classic celebrates 130 years of torture
description: Liege-Bastogne-Liege rarely fails to test riders. In its 130th year, a legend of the race looks back on his most remarkable win.

title: Match of the Day analysis: How Man City leapfrogged Liverpool
description: Match of the Day pundits Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards discuss Manchester City's win over Brighton that took them back top of the Premier League.

title: The young rebels fighting for democracy in Myanmar
description: The BBC gained rare access to Myanmar's jungle training camps where protesters are turned into soldiers.

title: Russia releases video of intercontinental ballistic missile launch
description: President Putin says the new Sarmat missile is food for thought for those who try to threaten Russia.

title: Ukraine round-up: Mariupol civilians remain trapped and Russian oligarch decries 'massacre'
description: A 91-year-old Holocaust survivor is named among city's reported dead and one of Russia's richest oligarchs decries the war as a 'massacre'.

title: Steve Coogan says Jimmy Savile drama The Reckoning 'will vindicate itself'
description: Steve Coogan, who will play Jimmy Savile on TV, says his abuse shouldn't be swept "under the carpet".

title: Ukraine war: Holocaust survivor aged 91 among Mariupol's civilian dead - reports
description: The woman reportedly died in a basement more than 80 years after surviving the city's Nazi occupiers.

title: Grenfell Tower: Man admits posting grossly offensive model video
description: The clip of a model Grenfell Tower burning on a bonfire was made at a party a year after the disaster.

title: Boris Johnson ignores Labour call to apologise to Archbishop
description: Sir Keir Starmer demands an apology over comments Boris Johnson made to a private meeting of Tory MPs.

title: Wimbledon 2022: Russian & Belarusian players banned from tournament
description: Russian and Belarusian players will not be allowed to compete at Wimbledon this year because of the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Andy Murray accepts Madrid Open wildcard, reversing decision to skip clay-court season
description: Andy Murray will play on clay in Madrid next week after accepting a tournament wildcard.

title: Tom Parker: Fans pay respects at The Wanted singer's funeral
description: Hundreds gather outside the funeral of The Wanted singer, who died last month at the age of 33.

title: Ukraine war: Mariupol ultimatum passes as hundreds shelter in steel mill
description: As a Russian ultimatum for Mariupol's surrender passes, Kyiv hopes to evacuate thousands still trapped.

title: Netflix hints at password sharing crackdown as subscribers fall
description: The firm needs to sign up new subscribers after losing 200,000 in the first quarter of the year.

title: Six Nations: Wales v Ireland to open 2023 tournament
description: Wales will play Ireland in Cardiff in the first match of the 2023 Six Nations, with England travelling to Dublin in the tournament's last game.

title: Ezra Miller: US actor arrested over assault in Hawaii
description: The actor reportedly threw a chair at a woman, leaving her with a cut to her head, on Tuesday.

title: Betsi Cadwaladr: Carer arrested over patient WhatsApp video claims
description: North Wales Police arrested a member of staff from Wrexham Maelor Hospital following allegations.

title: Prince Harry says he is making sure the Queen is protected
description: The Duke of Sussex says he wants his grandmother to have "the right people around her".

title: Courtney Lawes a doubt for England's tour of Australia because of dislocated thumb
description: Courtney Lawes' inclusion in England's July tour of Australia could be in doubt after the forward dislocated his thumb playing for Northampton.

title: Damaris Muthee Mutua: Kenya police launch manhunt after athlete killed
description: Damaris Muthee Mutua is the second female runner to have been killed in the famous Iten athletics base in a year.

title: The Easter egg that's gone uneaten for more than 70 years
description: Sally Evans says it was 'too valuable to eat' after her brother bought it with his first pay packet.

title: NI election 2022: Campaigners say change needed to get more women into Stormont
description: A record number of women are standing in the NI election - but more needs to change, say campaigners.

title: 'Rare condition gives me TV static in my vision'
description: A 19-year-old from South Lanarkshire has a little known condition which constantly affects her vision.

title: Ukraine war: Mariupol fighters' relatives tell of bitter pride
description: Relatives speak of their pride and fears for the last Ukrainian soldiers defending Mariupol.

title: Highway Code: Watching TV in self-driving cars to be allowed
description: Mobile phone use while driving will remain illegal, as changes to the Highway Code are announced.

title: Urine bugs may be a sign of aggressive prostate cancer
description: The discovery may lead to ways to spot and even prevent dangerous tumours, experts hope.

title: Why Koreans could soon become a year younger
description: The new government has proposed getting rid of the country's age systems, but experts are divided.
